p: Due to its extreme nucleic acid sequence heterogeneity, HIV consists of several different strains, swarms, clades, and recombinant forms. Individuals may harbor different strains, simultaneously [ 7â€“ 9, 36]. HIV is classified into two overall groups with numeric designations, HIV-1 and HIV-2. HIV-1 is most common and is found globally. HIV-2 is primarily found in Western Africa [ 10]. Due to its extreme ability to mutate, HIV can escape from immune surveillance and continue infection and proliferation [ 11].
